abstract: The New Yorker dwells at length on Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg, a complicated figure who apparently does treasure openness over privacy and doesn’t care much for money.
snippet: The New Yorker dwells at length on Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg, a complicated figure who apparently does treasure openness over privacy and doesn’t care much for money.
lead_paragraph: There is the Mark Zuckerberg of “The Social Network.” At least based on press reports, he is a paranoid “insecure jerk” pressing his nose against the window of Harvard’s finals clubs, whose entree into fame was Facebook.
